investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, of 200% of the daily performance of AAPL.
principal_strategies: Under normal circumstances, the Fund invests at least 80% of its net assets in common shares of AAPL and financial instruments, such as swap agreements and options, that together seek to provide 2X daily leveraged exposure to AAPL. The Fund rebalances its holdings daily and most commonly uses swap agreements.

fund_name: iShares Inflation Hedged U.S. Aggregate Bond ETF
investment_objective: The Fund seeks to track the investment results of an index designed to mitigate the inflation risk of a portfolio composed of U.S. dollar-denominated, investment-grade bonds.
principal_strategies: The Fund uses a passive, indexing approach to track the BlackRock Inflation Hedged U.S. Aggregate Bond Index by investing at least 80% of its assets in index components, primarily through inflation swap contracts of varying maturities and by holding shares of the iShares Core U.S. Aggregate Bond ETF (AGG), using representative sampling and other inflation hedging instruments such as TIPS, total return swaps, futures, and options.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, of -2 times (-200%) the daily percentage change of the common stock of Coinbase Global, Inc. Class A (NASDAQ: COIN).
principal_strategies: The Fund is an actively managed ETF that seeks to deliver -200% of the daily performance of its Underlying Stock by entering into financial instruments such as swap agreements and options on Coinbase Global, Inc. Class A. It rebalances its portfolio daily to maintain approximately -200% exposure to the Underlying Stock, primarily using swaps and, if necessary, options.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks to provide exposure, on a total return basis, to the price performance of gold.
principal_strategies: The Fund seeks to achieve its investment objective by investing primarily in a combination of exchange-traded gold futures contracts, OTC derivatives (forwards, futures, options and swaps) that correlate to physical gold, and exchange-traded products backed by or linked to physical gold. The Fund may invest up to 20% of its assets in OTC derivatives and may invest up to 25% of its total assets through a wholly-owned Cayman Islands subsidiary that invests solely in Gold Investments and cash equivalents.

fund_name: Defiance Daily Target 2X Long MSTR ETF
investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, of two times (200%) the daily percentage change in the share price of MicroStrategy Incorporated (Nasdaq: MSTR). The Fund does not seek to achieve its stated investment objective for a period other than a single trading day.
principal_strategies: The Fund is an actively managed ETF that targets 2X the daily percentage change in MicroStrategy Incorporated by entering into swap agreements and, as needed, listed options contracts. The Fund rebalances its holdings each day to maintain approximately 200% exposure to the Underlying Security.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, of 2 times (200%) the daily percentage change of the common stock of NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ: NVDA).
principal_strategies: The Fund attempts to replicate twice the daily percentage change of NVIDIA common stock by primarily entering into swap agreements, and, as needed, by using options and direct purchases of the Underlying Stock. At the end of each trading day it rebalances to maintain approximately 200% notional exposure to the Underlying Stock.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks to track the investment results (before fees and expenses) of the PHLX Semiconductor Sector Index.
principal_strategies: The Fund generally invests at least 90% of its total assets in the securities comprising the Underlying Index. The Fund employs a full replication methodology, investing in all of those securities in proportion to their weightings. The Underlying Index is a modified market capitalization-weighted index of the 30 largest U.S.-listed semiconductor companies and is rebalanced annually in September and reweighted quarterly. The Fund is non-diversified.

fund_name: Defiance Daily Target 2X Short PLTR ETF
investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily inverse investment results, before fees and expenses, of -2 times (-200%) the daily percentage change in the share price of Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ: PLTR). The Fund does not seek to achieve its stated investment objective for a period other than a single trading day.
principal_strategies: The Fund is an actively managed ETF that attempts to achieve -2x the daily percentage change of the Underlying Security by using derivatives, primarily swap agreements and listed options, rebalancing its exposures daily. It may also invest in U.S. government securities, money market funds, bond ETFs and high-grade corporate debt as collateral for its derivative transactions.

fund_name: Innovator Uncapped Bitcoin 20 Floor ETF — Quarterly
investment_objective: The Fund seeks to provide investors with investment results that participate in a percentage of any positive price returns of bitcoin (prior to taking into account management fees, shareholder transaction fees, brokerage commissions, taxes and any extraordinary expenses incurred by the Fund) while providing a maximum loss of 20% of any bitcoin price return losses (prior to taking into account management fees, shareholder transaction fees, brokerage commissions, taxes and any extraordinary expenses incurred by the Fund), over successive three-month periods.
principal_strategies: The Fund employs a defined outcome strategy by investing in FLEXible Exchange® Options referencing one or more exchange-traded products that hold bitcoin directly or the CBOE Bitcoin U.S. ETF Index, together with U.S. Treasury bills, to seek an 80.00% participation rate in positive Bitcoin Price returns and provide a 20% floor on Bitcoin Price losses over successive approximately three-month Outcome Periods. It may gain exposure via a Cayman Islands subsidiary and rebalances its portfolio at each Outcome Period’s outset.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, of 300% of the inverse (or opposite) of the daily performance of the S&P 500® Index.
principal_strategies: Under normal circumstances, the Fund invests at least 80% of its net assets (plus borrowings for investment purposes) in swap agreements, futures contracts, or short positions to provide 3X daily inverse exposure to the S&P 500® Index, and rebalances daily to maintain its investment objective.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, that correspond to three times the inverse (-3x) of the daily performance of the Nasdaq-100® Index.
principal_strategies: The Fund invests in financial instruments that, in combination, should produce daily returns consistent with the Daily Target. The Fund will invest principally in swap agreements, futures contracts, money market instruments and cash equivalents and will rebalance its portfolio daily to maintain inverse leveraged exposure to the Nasdaq-100® Index.

investment_objective: The Fund seeks to track the investment results of an index composed of U.S. Treasury bonds with remaining maturities greater than twenty years.
principal_strategies: The Fund seeks to track the investment results of the ICE U.S. Treasury 20+ Year Bond Index (the “Underlying Index”), which measures the performance of public obligations of the U.S. Treasury that have a remaining maturity greater than twenty years. The Underlying Index consists of publicly-issued U.S. Treasury securities that have a remaining maturity greater than twenty years and have $300 million or more of outstanding face value, excluding amounts held by the Federal Reserve System (the “Fed”). In addition, the securities in the Underlying Index must be fixed-rate and denominated in U.S. dollars. Excluded from the Underlying Index are inflation-linked securities, Treasury bills, cash management bills, any government agency debt issued with or without a government guarantee and zero-coupon issues that have been stripped from coupon-paying bonds. The Underlying Index is weighted by market capitalization. The Fund uses a representative sampling indexing strategy to manage the Fund and generally invests at least 90% of its assets in the bonds of the Underlying Index and at least 95% of its assets in U.S. government bonds. The Fund may invest up to 10% of its assets in U.S. government bonds not included in the Underlying Index and up to 5% of its assets in repurchase agreements collateralized by U.S. government obligations and in cash and cash equivalents, including shares of money market funds advised by BFA or its affiliates.

investment_objective: ProShares UltraPro QQQ® (the “Fund”) seeks daily investment results, before fees and expenses, that correspond to three times (3x) the daily performance of the Nasdaq-100® Index.
principal_strategies: The Fund invests in financial instruments that, in combination, ProShare Advisors believes should produce daily returns consistent with its Daily Target. Under normal circumstances the Fund obtains leveraged exposure to at least 80% of its total assets in components of the Index or in instruments with similar economic characteristics. The Fund invests principally in equity securities, derivatives (including swap agreements and futures contracts), and money market instruments. The Fund rebalances its portfolio each day so that its exposure to the Index is aligned with the Daily Target.

fund_name: Vanguard Health Care Index Fund ETF Shares
investment_objective: The Fund seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of health care stocks.
principal_strategies: The Fund employs an indexing investment approach designed to track the performance of the MSCI US Investable Market Index (IMI)/Health Care 25/50, an index made up of stocks of large, mid-size, and small U.S. companies within the health care sector, as classified under the Global Industry Classification Standard (GICS). It attempts to replicate the target index by investing all, or substantially all, of its assets in the stocks that make up the Index, in order to hold each stock in approximately the same proportion as its weighting in the Index.

investment_objective: Vanguard 500 Index Fund seeks to track the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of large-capitalization stocks.
principal_strategies: The Fund employs a passive management—indexing investment approach designed to track the performance of the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index by investing all, or substantially all, of its assets in the stocks that make up the Index, holding each stock in approximately the same proportion as its weighting in the Index.

fund_name: The Energy Select Sector SPDR Fund
investment_objective: The Energy Select Sector SPDR Fund seeks to provide investment results that, before expenses, correspond generally to the price and yield performance of publicly traded equity securities of companies in the Energy Select Sector Index.
principal_strategies: The Fund employs a replication strategy, investing at least 95% of its total assets in the securities comprising the Energy Select Sector Index in approximately the same proportions as the Index under normal market conditions. The Fund may also invest in cash, cash equivalents, and money market instruments.

fund_name: Innovator Equity Defined Protection ETF™ — 1 Yr July
investment_objective: The Fund seeks to provide investors with returns that match the upside price return of the SPDR® S&P 500® ETF Trust, up to the upside cap of 7.00% (prior to fees), while providing a buffer against 100% of SPDR® S&P 500® ETF Trust losses, over the period from July 1, 2025 through June 30, 2026.
principal_strategies: The Fund employs a defined outcome strategy using FLEX Options on the SPDR® S&P 500® ETF Trust, seeking to deliver a 100% downside buffer and a 7.00% upside cap over one-year Outcome Periods from July 1 to June 30. The Fund purchases and sells European-style call and put FLEX Options designed to achieve these outcomes, actively managing its options portfolio, and invests at least 80% of its assets in such options, foregoing dividends on the Underlying ETF.
